item.title: Scalar product and direction cosines
item.description: MathJax = { loader: { load: ['input/tex-base', 'output/svg', 'ui/menu', '[tex]/require'] }, tex: { packages: ['base', 'require'], inlineMath: [['$latex', '$'], ['\\(', '\\)']], } }; When I learned about the scalar product in high school, I was somewhat surprised by how lucky its properties are. The treatment is usually this: define $latex x \cdot y = |x| |y| \cos \theta $, where $latex \theta $ is the angle between $latex x $ and $latex y $.
